title: EU clears merger of Essilor, Luxottica without conditions
text: March 1, 2018 / 10:48 AM / Updated 3 hours ago EU clears merger of Essilor, Luxottica without conditions Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Commission on Thursday approved the 48-billion-euro ($58.49 billion) merger of eyewear groups Luxottica ( LUX.MI ) and Essilor ( ESSI.PA ) without setting conditions, saying the merger would not harm competition. “We’ve received feedback from nearly 4,000 opticians in a market test in Europe that Essilor and Luxottica would not gain market power to harm competition,” EU Competition Commissioner Margrethe Vestager said in a statement. The deal between Luxottica, the world’s biggest eyeglass frame maker, and Essilor, the world No. 1 lens maker, would create a company that would make products for various well-known brands such as Oakley and Ray-Ban. Reuters reported in December that the deal would be cleared. Reporting by Robert-Jan Bartunek
